tasks: Review the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) and identify 3 areas where you can apply them to your current work, focusing on UI Craft & Visual Design. Document your findings in a 2-page report.

Create a simple wireframe of a hypothetical product feature using the 8-point grid system, highlighting how it addresses a common pain point in UX Fundamentals. Measure the time taken to complete this task and aim for under 1 hour.
Conduct a self-assessment of your current portfolio's navigation, identifying areas where you can improve user flow and accessibility. Document your findings in a 3-page report.
Apply Occam’s Razor to a recent design project, explaining how it helped you simplify the design and improve usability. Write a 1-page reflection on the experience.
Create a visual design system for a hypothetical product feature using Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles. Document your design decisions in a 2-page report.
Conduct a user research study to validate a hypothesis about a specific UX problem. Write a 3-page report summarizing your findings.
Develop a comprehensive design system for a hypothetical product feature, incorporating Miller’s Law and the 8-point grid system. Document your design decisions in a 4-page report.
Create a usability test plan to validate a hypothesis about a specific UX problem. Write a 2-page report outlining your approach.
Redesign your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system, focusing on accessibility and user flow. Measure the time taken to complete this task and aim for under 1 hour.
Create a comprehensive UX strategy document for a hypothetical product feature, incorporating Laws of UX principles. Write a 5-page report outlining your approach.
Conduct an expert review of your design work from the past 6 months, providing actionable feedback to improve UI Craft & Visual Design. Document your findings in a 3-page report.

Develop a capstone project that showcases your skills as a Strategic Lead UX Designer, incorporating all the principles learned throughout this 4-week program. Write a 10-page report documenting your design decisions and process.

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive business growth through user-centered design, leveraging your expertise in product thinking and strategy (96/100) to craft intuitive interfaces that delight users. By combining your skills in UI Craft & Visual Design (80/100), User Research & Validation (93/100), and Collaboration & Communication (96/100), you can lead cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions that exceed user expectations.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Occam's Razor and its Application in UX Design
topics.summary: Applying Occam's Razor to simplify design solutions will help Strategic Leads make data-driven decisions and reduce complexity in their designs.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing products or services using Occam's Razor and document the simplifications made to their design
Create a case study on how Occam's Razor was applied to improve user experience in a real-world project
Develop a template for applying Occam's Razor in UX design, including guidelines for prioritizing features and simplifying interactions

topics.name: Mastering User Research with the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework will enable Strategic Leads to gain deeper insights into user needs and behaviors, informing more effective design solutions.
practice_points: Conduct 5 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document findings
Analyze user research data from 2 existing projects and identify patterns of 'jobs' that can inform future design decisions
Develop a template for conducting Jobs-to-be-Done research, including guidelines for identifying and prioritizing 'jobs'

topics.name: Applying Jakob's Law to Improve Visual Design
topics.summary: Understanding and applying Jakob's Law will help Strategic Leads create more effective visual design solutions that prioritize content clarity and simplicity.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites or applications using Jakob's Law and document the ways in which they balance content and whitespace
Create a case study on how Jakob's Law was applied to improve visual design in a real-world project
Develop a style guide that incorporates Jakob's Law principles, including guidelines for typography, color, and spacing

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should have a solid foundation in UX principles to inform design decisions.
insights.detailed: A strong understanding of UX fundamentals is crucial for Strategic Leads to create user-centered designs. However, the current score of 84/100 indicates that there is room for improvement in this area. A deeper dive into UX best practices and staying up-to-date with industry trends can help bridge this gap.
actionable: Attend UX design workshops or conferences to stay current with industry developments
Read UX design books and blogs to deepen understanding of principles and best practices
Participate in online forums or communities to engage with other designers and learn from their experiences

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should have a keen eye for visual design to create aesthetically pleasing and user-friendly interfaces.
insights.detailed: While the current score of 80/100 is respectable, there is still room for improvement in UI craft and visual design. A stronger focus on visual design principles and staying current with design trends can help elevate designs and meet user expectations.
actionable: Take online courses or attend design workshops to improve visual design skills
Join a design community or network to learn from other designers and stay inspired
Experiment with different design tools and software to develop expertise

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should prioritize user research and validation to ensure designs meet user needs.
insights.detailed: The current score of 93/100 is strong, but there is still room for improvement in this area. A deeper dive into user research methods and staying current with industry best practices can help take research efforts to the next level.
actionable: Attend user research workshops or conferences to learn from experts
Read user research books and blogs to deepen understanding of methods and best practices
Participate in online forums or communities to engage with other researchers and learn from their experiences

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should have a solid understanding of product thinking and strategy to inform design decisions.
insights.detailed: The current score of 96/100 is outstanding, but there is still room for improvement in this area. A deeper dive into product development methodologies and staying current with industry trends can help take product thinking efforts to the next level.
actionable: Take online courses or attend product strategy workshops to improve understanding of product development methodologies
Join a product community or network to learn from other strategists and stay inspired
Experiment with different design tools and software to develop expertise in product thinking

insights.brief: Strategic Leads should prioritize collaboration and communication to effectively work with cross-functional teams.
insights.detailed: The current score of 96/100 is strong, but there is still room for improvement in this area. A deeper dive into effective communication strategies and staying current with industry best practices can help take collaboration efforts to the next level.
actionable: Attend collaboration workshops or conferences to learn from experts
Read communication books and blogs to deepen understanding of strategies and best practices
Participate in online forums or communities to engage with other designers and learn from their experiences
